abstract.text: Create app extensions that allow users to send text, stickers, media files, and interactive messages.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: You can use the Messages framework to create sticker packs and iMessage apps. You can create sticker packs and iMessage apps as either standalone apps or as app extensions within a containing iOS app. For more information on creating and working with app extensions, see
iMessage apps and stickers help people interact and communicate in the context of a Messages conversation. For design guidance, see
iMessage apps leverage the full framework to interact with the Messages app.
To avoid a crash, an iMessage app linked on or after iOS 10 must include usage description keys for the device features it needs to access in its
file. Specifically, it must include
to access the device’s camera, and it must include
to access the device’s microphones.
Use iMessage apps to:
Present a custom user interface inside the Messages app; see
Create a custom or dynamic sticker browser; see
Insert text, stickers, or media files into the Messages app’s input field; see
Create interactive messages that carry app-specific data; see
Update interactive messages (for example, to create games or collaborative apps); see
For more information on submitting iMessage Apps to the App Store, see

In iOS 17, Messages allows you to interactively resize iMessage apps with a vertical pan gesture. Messages handles any conflicts between resize gestures and your custom gestures. If your app uses manual touch handling such as
, and
, you can do either of the following:
Change your manual touch handling code to use a gesture recognizer instead.
Use your
to override
and return
when your iMessage app doesn’t own the gesture.
In iOS and iPadOS 18.2 and later, a person may select an app other than the Messages app to send instant messages. If you wish to make your app the default messages app, see

abstract.text: A message that tells the user why the app is requesting access to the device’s camera.
A message that tells the user why the app is requesting access to the device’s microphone.
Sent to the gesture recognizer when one or more fingers touch down in the associated view.
Sent to the gesture recognizer when one or more fingers lift from the associated view.
Sent to the gesture recognizer when one or more fingers move in the associated view.
Asks the delegate if a gesture recognizer should begin interpreting touches.
An object that manages the content for a rectangular area on the screen.
Create app extensions that allow users to send text, stickers, media files, and interactive messages.
An object that represents a conversation in the Messages app.
MSCriticalMessage
A simple struct to encapsulate the message string.
Values that describe the authorization status for the Critical Messaging API.
Values that describe errors the Critical Messaging API returns.
The user interface for the Critical Messaging API.
A custom message object.
The error codes that the Messages framework generates.
An abstract base class that defines the appearance of
objects in the conversation transcript.
A layout that provides a custom, interactive view inside the transcript.
A template-based layout for custom messages.
Presentation styles that describe your iMessage app’s appearance.
A protocol that provides support for displaying live messages in the transcript of the Messages app.
The principal view controller for iMessage apps.
The error domain for iMessage apps.
A structure that describes the recipient of a critical message.
A session object used to create and update messages.
A sticker that can be sent as a new message or attached to an existing balloon in the Messages app’s  transcript.
A browser view that displays a dynamically generated list of stickers.
A view controller that provides dynamic content to the standard sticker browser.
The size of the stickers in the browser view.
A view for displaying a sticker.
The error domain for stickers.
Configure your messaging app so people can set it as the default on their device.
